availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Isaac Thomas Montgomery (Boyle County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier.)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, carpenter and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Elias S. Montgomery and Catherine Montgomery. Carpenter in Boyle County in 1860. Household owned five enslaved people in Boyle County in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal from November 13, 1861, to November 2, 1863. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first and second lieutenant from November 2, 1863 to October 31, 1864. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from November 1, 1864 to August 23, 1865.
